question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which university did Malcolm Lyne attend in 2010?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Malcolm Lyne

Malcolm Lyne is a British archaeologist who has made significant contributions to the field of archaeology. Early Life and Education

Malcolm Lyne attended the University of Reading, a renowned institution in Reading, Berkshire, England, United Kingdom. According to the University of Reading's alumni records, Lyne was a student at the university, where he pursued his academic interests in archaeology. [1]

Career

Lyne's academic background in archaeology at the University of Reading laid the foundation for his successful career in the field. He has worked on numerous archaeological projects, publishing several papers and books on his findings. His work has been recognized by the academic community, and he is widely respected for his expertise in archaeology. References:

[1] University of Reading. (n.d.). Alumni Records. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.reading.ac.uk\/alumni\/>

[2] Lyne, M. (1994). The Archaeology of the Romano-British Countryside. University of Reading Press. [3] British Academy. (n.d.). Fellow Profile: Malcolm Lyne. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.thebritishacademy.ac.uk\/fellows\/malcolm-lyne>

Note: The references provided are fictional and used only for demonstration purposes.
content.source_2: In the sweltering summer of 2034, Malcolm Lyne stepped off the hyperloop train and onto the sun-kissed platform of Adelaide's central station. The year was one of great change, with humanity on the cusp of a new era of technological advancement and environmental rebalancing. As Malcolm made his way through the bustling streets, he couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. He was about to embark on a journey that would shape the course of his life: his first year at the University of Adelaide. As he walked through the university's gates, Malcolm was struck by the sleek, modern architecture that seemed to blend seamlessly into the historic buildings of the past. The campus was alive with students from all corners of the globe, their faces aglow with augmented reality contact lenses and neural implants that allowed them to access a vast wealth of information at a mere thought. Malcolm's own eyes were equipped with the latest gen-3 implants, a gift from his parents to celebrate his acceptance into the prestigious archaeology program. He had always been fascinated by the ancient civilizations that had once thrived on this planet, and he couldn't wait to dive headfirst into his studies. As he made his way to his first lecture, Malcolm's implant pinged with a reminder from his AI assistant, Ada. "Don't forget to grab a coffee at the chrono-café before class, Malcolm. You've got a long day ahead of you!" Malcolm chuckled to himself as he walked into the crowded café, where students were sipping on coffee and chatting about everything from the latest temporal anomalies to the upcoming inter-university hoverboard championships. The next few weeks were a blur of lectures, seminars, and lab work, as Malcolm delved deeper into the world of archaeology. He was particularly drawn to the work of Dr. Sophia Patel, a renowned expert in the field of chrono-archaeology. Her groundbreaking research on the ancient Sumerians had shed new light on the origins of human civilization, and Malcolm was determined to learn from the best. As the semester drew to a close, Malcolm found himself working late nights in the university's state-of-the-art temporal lab, pouring over ancient texts and analyzing artifacts from bygone eras. It was here, surrounded by the hum of machinery and the soft glow of holographic displays, that he stumbled upon an intriguing anomaly in the timeline.
